sections.description: Pure Go implementation of PlantUML diagram parser and SVG renderer supporting class and sequence diagrams.
sections.purpose: Provides a pure Go library and CLI tool to parse PlantUML text syntax and render diagrams to SVG without external dependencies. Enables programmatic diagram generation in Go applications and offers an HTTP server with a live editor for interactive diagram development.
strengths: Zero external dependencies - all functionality implemented in pure Go
Comprehensive lexer, parser, and AST for PlantUML syntax
Dual diagram support - both class and sequence diagrams with specialized renderers
Modular architecture with clear separation of concerns (lexer, parser, layout, renderer, theme)
Public library API (pkg/gouml) alongside CLI and HTTP server
Golden test fixtures for regression testing SVG output
Theme engine with customizable skinparams for styling control
Font metrics system for accurate text measurement in layout calculations
weaknesses: Still in active development - only phases 1-2 of 13-phase plan merged
Limited PlantUML syntax coverage - parser supports core features, not all edge cases
Font metrics rely on hardcoded values rather than system font data
SVG rendering covers basic class/sequence diagram features
No comprehensive error messages for unsupported syntax
Limited documentation beyond code comments and plan files
sections.test_coverage: 20 test files across all major packages with 45 total Go files (44% test-to-code ratio). Test organization uses parent test functions with subtests (e.g., TestParse with t.Run subtests). Golden test files for SVG output validation. Key test areas: lexer tokenization, parser error recovery, AST construction, layout algorithms, SVG rendering, theme resolution, server endpoints, encoding, font metrics. All tests use t.Parallel().
sections.dependencies: No external dependencies in go.mod. Internal package graph: pkg/gouml → internal/{parser, renderer/svg, theme, ast} → internal/{lexer, layout, font, encoding, validation}. Internal tools via go.mod: golangci-lint (linting), gofumpt (formatting), and 70+ transitive dependencies for CLI tools.
sections.functionality: Root module exports: library API via pkg/gouml (Render, Parse, Validate, RenderDiagram with Options). CLI via cmd/go-uml (render, validate, serve commands). HTTP server via internal/server for live editing. Internal packages provide: lexical analysis (lexer), syntax tree construction (parser, ast), diagram layout algorithms (layout with coordinate/layering/crossing subpackages), SVG generation (renderer/svg), theming system (theme), font handling (font), data encoding (encoding), input validation (validation), and development tools (tools).
